commit_message:
Check baremetal flavors for custom resource class

Since queens it has become mandatory for baremetal flavors to have a
custom resource class defined for scheduling by the baremetal service.
When flavors do not have custom resource classes, we run into scheduling
bugs like https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1560690. This
commit ensures that all baremetal flavors are associated with some
custom resource class.

Change-Id: I2d34c41a2bb2a6cce74bbe70faf7371eb9016b72
(cherry picked from commit b213c25bee35e05d7724c2dd22fbfda64f409e1a)

commit_message:
Always use the fqdn in ipa-client enrollment

There is no reason not to use the fqdn provided in the metadata.
We always check for it and already use it in the case of a mismatch.
Moreover, it is necessary in some cases - for instance, when the
domain does not match the realm.

Change-Id: I4ea0e48329fc516bf464078df8547d49315ea5dc

[{'created': '2019-08-16 10:21:00.000000000', 'message': "Add tripleo-admin user's pub key into mistral's container home.

Copy the tripleo-admin public key also into mistral's container
home directory (var/lib/mistral) with the intention of reusing
the very same key for accessing the overcloud nodes. As currently
we create a new key from the mistral workflow get_privkey or
get_pubkey if there was no ssh_keys parameter in the Mistral
environment. This would allow us to access the Undercloud node
with the very same key as we use to acces the Overcloud nodes.

Change-Id: I7b1f7da6d7c31251f2bff6a78b6ed5d4397b677d
Related-Bug: #1832932
"}]
commit_message:
Add tripleo-admin user's pub key into mistral's container home.

Copy the tripleo-admin public key also into mistral's container
home directory (var/lib/mistral) with the intention of reusing
the very same key for accessing the overcloud nodes. As currently
we create a new key from the mistral workflow get_privkey or
get_pubkey if there was no ssh_keys parameter in the Mistral
environment. This would allow us to access the Undercloud node
with the very same key as we use to acces the Overcloud nodes.

Change-Id: I7b1f7da6d7c31251f2bff6a78b6ed5d4397b677d
Related-Bug: #1832932

commit_message:
Ignore if nova_wsgi is not running under systemctl

[queens only] With Pike, nova_wsgi is already running in containers, so this check will fail as the service won't be found under systemctl. The script should ignore errors and continue.

Change-Id: I9c0040b3a0ad6f0d09c42e64beeb0446ad4664b7
Closes-Bug: #1807966

commit_message:
Workaround due to puppet-sensu bug that enables SSL even if disabled

There is a bug in the puppet-sensu package that enables SSL in the
rabbitmq.json config file for the sensu agent even when disabled in
the TripleO deploy data.

Change-Id: Ia926ac524801cc473199795cf3792c684ea9662d
Closes-Bug: #1813351

Rist', 'email': 'jrist@redhat.com', 'username': 'jrist'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20970, 'name': 'Honza Pokorny', 'email': 'honza@redhat.com', 'username': 'hpokorny'}, {'_account_id': 21794, 'name': 'Dan Trainor', 'email': 'dtrainor@redhat.com', 'username': 'dtrainor'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-09-03 13:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-09-03 13:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you also update the tls-everywhere-endpoints environment?'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-09-03 14:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-09-05 15:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-09-11 22:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

well done!'}, {'account_id': 10112, 'date': '2018-09-12 17:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

From what I can tell this is what we need.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-09-12 21:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-12 22:21:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Looks like in CI it's still bound to the 192.168.24.x addresses, 

tcp        0      0 192.168.24.2:13000      0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      19423/haproxy


http://logs.openstack.org/00/599400/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/f389bb9/logs/undercloud/var/log/host_info.txt.gz"}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-09-12 22:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Interesting.

The port setting is certainly getting through:

<VirtualHost 192.168.24.2:443>

http://logs.openstack.org/00/599400/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/f389bb9/logs/undercloud/var/log/config-data/tripleo-ui/etc/httpd/conf.d/25-tripleo-ui.conf.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-13 09:43:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Looks like in CI it's still bound to the 192.168.24.x addresses, 

tcp        0      0 192.168.24.2:13000      0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      19423/haproxy

What is 13000 and why is that bad?..
I can see as well
tcp        0      0 192.168.24.3:3000       0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      19423/haproxy
tcp        0      0 192.168.24.2:443        0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      19423/haproxy

which is kinda expected by the patch, right?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-13 14:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

no the issue is that we probably want the UI on the network on the other interface (non-provisioning/controlplane)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-09-13 19:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I don't think this patch will function the way it's intended. The undercloud doesn't actually have an "external" network that can be referenced in templates. The undercloud stack itself doesn't refer to the public network used by the undercloud, it's just a default route on the undercloud host itself. The "external" network referred to in the service_net_map.j2.yaml is an overcloud-only network. It is common to add an interface to the external network on the undercloud host, but it isn't referenced anywhere in the undercloud Heat stack. Of course, the existing entry in service_net_map.j2.yaml that points the internal_api network is also probably not working, since the Internal API network is not usually attached to the undercloud at all.

I think what you are trying to do is host the TripleO UI on the undercloud uplink interface (which is the IP of the virthost in virt environments due to NAT), like in this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1782438

In order to do that, we'll have to modify the undercloud stack so that the uplink interface can be referred to in the undercloud stack templates. We might need a new value in undercloud.conf, something like "undercloud_uplink_host" or "undercloud_external_host", and then incorporate that value into the undercloud Heat stack.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:12:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Another option would be to add a reference to the external network, and create a port on the external network for the undercloud. That would then allow the templates to refer to the external network in the undercloud stack. The problem is that not all deployments use an External network IP on the undercloud. It isn't usually required if the undercloud can get to the overcloud external network via routing, and currently when the undercloud is attached directly to the external network it's an interface on the undercloud host, but there isn't a corresponding Neutron network or port in the undercloud stack."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think it might be solved by using the undercloud_*_host configuration items to specify that with the external ip information. It would be something to test'}, {'account_id': 21794, 'date': '2018-09-26 21:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I think it might be solved by using the undercloud_*_host
 > configuration items to specify that with the external ip
 > information. It would be something to test

Traditionally, this value did come from undercloud_public_host and that's what was used for HAProxy to listen on the externally routable interface we're talking about, as well as the value used in tripleo_ui_config.js that UI uses.  But I'm not sure if that has changed, or when."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-27 08:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Ewww... I have to note that the situation with those undercloud_public* 
host/vip vs admin* parameters, and network configs, and (not working?) composable networking mappings for public/internal networks - is highly confusing.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-09-18 16:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html'}]

commit_message:
Sharing BGPVPN Heat plugin volume

  This will allow heat-engine container to consume
  the plugin.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 14:15:34.000000000', 'message': 'Don't mount data folder

"data" folder mounted on host sometimes makes ODL
believe that it has boot features installed. So ODL
doesnot generate required files.

So don't mount that folder so that ODL can boot
properly on restart.

Closes-Bug: #1805859

Change-Id: Icb415f6ac379e757edfe6dd73f80484a6697d152
'}]
commit_message:
Don't mount data folder

"data" folder mounted on host sometimes makes ODL
believe that it has boot features installed. So ODL
doesnot generate required files.

So don't mount that folder so that ODL can boot
properly on restart.

Closes-Bug: #1805859

Change-Id: Icb415f6ac379e757edfe6dd73f80484a6697d152

commit_message:
Docker BM ansible deployment: Use the renamed login task

The container registry is being expanded to support login with other
tools and within other environments.
This change uses the gnerical renamed "registry-login" instead of the
specific "docker-login"

Change-Id: I012d5e2ac4883e19cab8316598ed516d1df9e0cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673481

commit_message:
set mod_auth_openidc cache type to memcache

When its behind a load balancer, mod_auth_openidc requires shared
state (or sticky sessions). Since we already have memcache available,
configure mod_auth_openidc to use memcache.

Depends-on: I9ff976854b93cdf9ca3175d1fd39c2b268b9f7fa
Change-Id: Iff0abdfd7605d839e8ab145078de523864db4660

[{'created': '2019-06-26 07:50:40.000000000', 'message': "Allow networks in roles_data to be dict or list

With the changes to make all networks for the overcloud
neutron routed networks it makes sense to change the
schema of 'networks' in roles_data to allow the user to
specify both the networks and the subnet of each network
for a role.

Ref change: I85676ae961d34bf6a986fa813c40380d50f09711

This changes the role yaml validation to allow 'networks'
to be either a list or a dict.

Related: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969
(cherry picked from commit 6d52f5b9acc9b4d587bb36dd8afb7c77e24422e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow networks in roles_data to be dict or list

With the changes to make all networks for the overcloud
neutron routed networks it makes sense to change the
schema of 'networks' in roles_data to allow the user to
specify both the networks and the subnet of each network
for a role.

Ref change: I85676ae961d34bf6a986fa813c40380d50f09711

This changes the role yaml validation to allow 'networks'
to be either a list or a dict.

Related: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969
(cherry picked from commit 6d52f5b9acc9b4d587bb36dd8afb7c77e24422e7)

commit_message:
Add serial option in the inventory

Add serial option in the inventory in order to be able
to set serial value per roles by the user if needed.

Default will still remain the same: 1

Change-Id: I6605aec1d42a714f2f2c72b9233bc3bf510177de
(cherry picked from commit 8852437732018b41d167fc3c41655958f47d6e32)

commit_message:
Fix nova-placement healthcheck url, remove placement prefix

    * There is placement prefix in the healthcheck url, that's
    not needed anymore, because this value is taken from apache config,
    10-placement_wsgi.conf "WSGIScriptAlias /placement"

Change-Id: I3eeb09a92e26d4e05cfb823352570d0800345f88

[{'created': '2019-08-16 11:02:54.000000000', 'message': "Use tripleo-admin existing key to access the OC nodes.

Currently, when installing the Undercloud a tripleo-admin
user is created and its keys are stored in /var/lib/mistral/.ssh.
However, instead of using this keys to access via ssh from the
mistral_executor container to other Overcloud nodes (by Ansible)
we create a new private and public key and store it into Mistral's
environment.
This patch will check if the private and public keys exist under
/var/lib/mistral/.ssh/ and if they do, store those ones under
Mistral's environment variable ssh_keys. If for any reason, they
are not there, then we'll create the new keys as we were doing
up to now.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676899

commit_message:
Use tripleo-admin existing key to access the OC nodes.

Currently, when installing the Undercloud a tripleo-admin
user is created and its keys are stored in /var/lib/mistral/.ssh.
However, instead of using this keys to access via ssh from the
mistral_executor container to other Overcloud nodes (by Ansible)
we create a new private and public key and store it into Mistral's
environment.
This patch will check if the private and public keys exist under
/var/lib/mistral/.ssh/ and if they do, store those ones under
Mistral's environment variable ssh_keys. If for any reason, they
are not there, then we'll create the new keys as we were doing
up to now.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676899
Change-Id: Ia7a10d5ea34e008b2a0f81df064e5b1912f4930e
Related-Bug: #1832932

commit_message:
Add serial option in the inventory

Add serial option in the inventory in order to be able
to set serial value per roles by the user if needed.

Default will still remain the same: 1

Change-Id: I6605aec1d42a714f2f2c72b9233bc3bf510177de
(cherry picked from commit 8852437732018b41d167fc3c41655958f47d6e32)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22094, 'name': 'kobig', 'email': 'kobi.ginon@nokia.com', 'username': 'kobigi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29059, 'name': 'Yael Azulay', 'email': 'yael.azulay@nokia.com', 'username': 'yaelazulay'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 29059, 'date': '2018-09-17 16:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22094, 'date': '2018-09-17 16:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks yael
this is indeed proven to be according to redhat as a change that helps in big environment.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-18 09:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You probably wanted to keep only https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602038?'}, {'account_id': 29059, 'date': '2018-09-20 11:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Bogdan Dobrelya: I did Abandon to the first review and left the fixed one'}, {'account_id': 29059, 'date': '2018-09-20 11:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29059, 'date': '2018-09-21 09:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-09-21 13:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Overall this change should probably go through but this commit needs more background information, other people that see this don't know what the note in question is or what it says.  There should be a written rationale for each setting here (like a launchpad issue or something).   There are two major issues with tripleo making assumptions on settings that a particular operator noted worked for them:  the first is that we cannot assume the hardware target, and some settings might not be compatible with smaller hardware.  The second and probably bigger issue is that all documentation and blog posts about these MySQL settings assume the database is running on its own host, which tripleo by default does *not* do.   Settings that try to give the whole server over to MySQL may not be appropriate because all the other services are competing for the same resources.

innodb_buffer_pool_size: 128M is the default already, are we going to suggest a bigger number?  and if so, what's a specific scenario we're targeting?  If this is because a user of Openstack Newton had trouble with their keystone token table, that does not apply here since we don't use this table anymore.  keystone already caches reads in memcached and does extremely low access on the database.    are we experiencing slow reads elsewhere, e.g. nova, neutron etc?  


innodb_io_capacity: from https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/innodb-parameters.html#sysvar_innodb_io_capacity, "The default value is 200. For busy systems capable of higher I/O rates, you can set a higher value to help the server handle the background maintenance work associated with a high rate of row changes. The default setting of 200 is generally sufficient for a lower-end SSD. For a higher-end, bus-attached SSD, consider a higher setting such as 1000, for example. For systems with individual 5400 RPM or 7200 RPM drives, you might lower the value to 100, which represents an estimated proportion of the I/O operations per second (IOPS) available to older-generation disk drives that can perform about 100 IOPS. " - 800 seems very high as a default here.

innodb_log_file_size: 1G is probably good

innodb_buffer_pool_instances: 8 is the default when you have the 1G set above so it's good.'}, {'account_id': 29059, 'date': '2018-09-21 15:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > a written rationale for each setting here (like a launchpad issue
 > or something).   There are two major issues with tripleo making
 > assumptions on settings that a particular operator noted worked for
 > them:  the first is that we cannot assume the hardware target, and
 > some settings might not be compatible with smaller hardware.  The

commit_message:
Changes are needed for performance and stability at large intervals

innodb_io_capacity, innodb_log_file_size, innodb_buffer_pool_size, innodb_buffer_pool_instances:
  We added the option to change the value of these fields for performance purposes, as required by our system.
  We change the values by ansible script on post installation by hiera
  When nothing is done – there is no effect on these fields. Default value is set
  For example:
  innodb_buffer_pool_size -  increase the cache size, and prevent the continues flushing to disks. When the size is increase, the usage of the disk is reduced.

innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit -  We changed it to enhance the performance, as we reduce the number of flushes to disk from 1 per transaction, to 1 per second

innodb_log_file_size: 1G , we set it to 1 GB as recommended by Redhat, for logging improvements
innodb_buffer_pool_instances: we set it to 8 was  recommended by Redhat, for logging improvements

31.10 - make innodb_log_file_size and innodb_buffer_pool_instances - hiera

Change-Id: I9cf996308e47837f700ed3709e36e2bd7270876d

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context. [

1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: I42246ccdfd07726339fde33874a1382f964b9659
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>
Story: #2004073

Run master to master upgrade only

Remove all the tasks related to the settings of the repo
to enable upgrade only on master to master

Change-Id: I1c394484f04d65ff1996825a723ffa14f045a276

commit_message:
build-test-packages: Add support for zuul inventory vars

Add an alternative way to build the zuul changes list, based on information on
changes to review taken from zuul inventory when they are present

Depends-On: I8d7c877b64cf22c00b1ad538f25ad4ff87574a8a
Change-Id: I8272e202eefa920bf05464b6db71f7ff8e07d7ba

subject: Use upgrade_composable_scenario in prep container images prior to upgrade.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26343, 'name': 'Jose Luis Franco', 'email': 'jfrancoa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jfrancoa'}]

[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-04 08:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-04 13:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to refactor_upgrades'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-05 07:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-05 11:58:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't fully understand this one, but will all that jazz necessary when we get rid of the mixed release file.  Ie, won't overcloud-prep-containers do the right thing then ?"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-09 14:01:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't fully understand this one, but will all that jazz necessary
 > when we get rid of the mixed release file.  Ie, won't
 > overcloud-prep-containers do the right thing then ?

This one is kind of tricky..and impacts only to the ocata-to-pike job which was non-containerized to containerized. If you remember for that job we had two scenarios the multinode.yaml and the multinode-containers.yaml , so we're always passing the one for the deployment to prep-containers (which is fine when upgrading from container to container because the scenario matches, but not when it is from non-containerized to containerized, see the environment files being passed in PREPARE_ARGS https://logs.rdoproject.org/21/604121/10/openstack-experimental/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode-upgrades-pike-branch/fc555d2/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/upgrade_overcloud_prep_containers.sh.txt.gz 
Anyway, taking into account that pike will be eol some time soon, it does not make sense to worry so much about this anymore. I just thought it was the reason why O->P job was failing, but it seems it's something else."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-09-18 16:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 08:01:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use upgrade_composable_scenario in prep container images prior to upgrade.

This case impacts mainly to the ocata->pike upgrade
scenario in which we upgrade from non containerized
to containerized. In this case, the scenario file is
different from deployment to upgrade, and at the time
of preparing the container images to upgrade we better
pass the composable service scenario for the containerized
deployment to which we are going to upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic6c1e3a5bcd17678c90529a0caa70a390bed1a38
'}, {'created': '2018-10-05 07:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use upgrade_composable_scenario in prep container images prior to upgrade.

This case impacts mainly to the ocata->pike upgrade
scenario in which we upgrade from non containerized
to containerized. In this case, the scenario file is
different from deployment to upgrade, and at the time
of preparing the container images to upgrade we better
pass the composable service scenario for the containerized
deployment to which we are going to upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic6c1e3a5bcd17678c90529a0caa70a390bed1a38
'}]
commit_message:
Use upgrade_composable_scenario in prep container images prior to upgrade.

This case impacts mainly to the ocata->pike upgrade
scenario in which we upgrade from non containerized
to containerized. In this case, the scenario file is
different from deployment to upgrade, and at the time
of preparing the container images to upgrade we better
pass the composable service scenario for the containerized
deployment to which we are going to upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic6c1e3a5bcd17678c90529a0caa70a390bed1a38

WIP: Reproduce CI multinode job with libvirt

on libvirt hosts.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 15:10:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add subnode-setup.yml playbook.

Currently the overcloud subnode setting up is being done
in multinode-undercloud.yml playbook in which the undercloud
setup release file is being passed. This works fine for most
of the CI jobs, but not for the mixed versions, where the
subnode needs a release-1 repo setting up.
This patch adds a new playbook subnodes-setup.yaml, which
contains all the tasks in charge of configuring the overcloud
subnode. In another patch  will be linked the right release
to be passed when running this playbook.

Change-Id: I420073ac231805bf132713250a3c52bcde7163f7
Related-Bug: #1791115

Change-Id: I420073ac231805bf132713250a3c52bcde7163f7
Related-Bug: #1791115
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add subnode-setup.yml playbook.

Currently the overcloud subnode setting up is being done
in multinode-undercloud.yml playbook in which the undercloud
setup release file is being passed. This works fine for most
of the CI jobs, but not for the mixed versions, where the
subnode needs a release-1 repo setting up.
This patch adds a new playbook subnodes-setup.yaml, which
contains all the tasks in charge of configuring the overcloud
subnode. In another patch  will be linked the right release
to be passed when running this playbook.

Change-Id: I420073ac231805bf132713250a3c52bcde7163f7
Related-Bug: #1791115

commit_message:
Adding browbeat_workload file to fs053

Browbeat is breaking config file into workload and config
thus there is a need to add new variables like browbeat_workload_file
, browbeat_rerun and browbeat_metadata_regather

Change-Id: Id7dd6dc017c29c7f5b9a253b609ab442cd8e5102

commit_message:
Remove ovs role

We moveed installing of ovs to tripleo-heat-templates.
This role masks problems with ovs installation for
some deployments done directly by tripleo-client.

Change-Id: Ic85799c2f38598510605495a2b2ed7048d4a5dfa
Related-Bug: #1804264

commit_message:
Update deployed_server and config_download_args in upgrades featuresets.

The upgrades featuresets were not synchronized in the
assigned value for the deployed_server and config_download_args
 parameter. This patch makes its value dependent on the release,
as it is done for most of the featuresets.

Change-Id: I18607b3036e5f9fd6b6d8f98ea815a630f32e656

commit_message:
Implement unified installation and setup

This change adds a single install script taht will deal with every
installation and setup tasks for quickstart.
The script has no dependencies, is able to work alone, so it can be
downloaded and run independently

Set deprecation wanring for all the install and setup tasks that are not
part of the install script

Change-Id: I0a0370cc295933fd3ce204e835a155bba2128c9f

commit_message:
full-job-ovb: explicitly specify nodes parameter

quickstart.sh now sets a hardcoded default that is not taking into
consideration previous definitions of OPT_NODES.
Specifying --nodes paramters should fix this, and it's the right
way to call quckstart.sh now.

Change-Id: I2d03a57001fab6cc217c19d773f8feef5890abd3

subject: WIP: Move overcloud_templates_* vars into featuresets for mixed_upgrade jobs.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26343, 'name': 'Jose Luis Franco', 'email': 'jfrancoa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jfrancoa'}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ngétal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-02 12:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-02 12:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to refactor_upgrades'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-05 07:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-05 12:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Unless I missed something, we want to get rid of this altogether.

We shouldn't need those variable anymore as each release file will have the proper release variable and we won't need those extra variables anymore.

The goal here is to get rid of those "special upgrade release variable" and special upgrade code path altogether.

So when we call multinode-"deploy" it has the N-1 release variable set thanks to emit release, and container/repo are rights.

When we call the multinode upgrade one it has the N release variable set and everything work accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Unless I missed something, we want to get rid of this altogether.
 > 
 > We shouldn't need those variable anymore as each release file will
 > have the proper release variable and we won't need those extra
 > variables anymore.
 > 
 > The goal here is to get rid of those "special upgrade release
 > variable" and special upgrade code path altogether.
 > 
 > So when we call multinode-"deploy" it has the N-1 release variable
 > set thanks to emit release, and container/repo are rights.
 > 
 > When we call the multinode upgrade one it has the N release
 > variable set and everything work accordingly.

I agree with you in the statement overall, but we need these three variables defined somewhere for the mixed version deployment to work. These overcloud_templates* vars lets us specify the release we want for the templates to download and the location where we want them. This way we can have an N release undercloud and deploy an N-1 release overcloud.
If we remove them, the default will be taken, which is pointing at /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates and we won't be deploying a N-1 release overcloud but N release.
I talked to Quique, that as a first step we could move this variables to the featuresets (so they would work in the new and legacy workflow) and then moving them to the Upgrades jobs zuul v3 definition, so we don't need to be replicating them. Wdyt?'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-10 08:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jose Luis Franco wrote:

> > Unless I missed something, we want to get rid of this altogether.
 > 
 > We shouldn't need those variable anymore as each release file will
 > have the proper release variable and we won't need those extra
 > variables anymore.
 > 
 > The goal here is to get rid of those "special upgrade release
 > variable" and special upgrade code path altogether.
 > 
 > So when we call multinode-"deploy" it has the N-1 release variable
 > set thanks to emit release, and container/repo are rights.
 > 
 > When we call the multinode upgrade one it has the N release
 > variable set and everything work accordingly.
>
> I agree with you in the statement overall, but we need these three
> variables defined somewhere for the mixed version deployment to
> work. These overcloud_templates* vars lets us specify the release we
> want for the templates to download and the location where we want
> them. This way we can have an N release undercloud and deploy an N-1
> release overcloud. If we remove them, the default will be taken,
> which is pointing at /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates and
> we won't be deploying a N-1 release overcloud but N release. I
> talked to Quique, that as a first step we could move this variables
> to the featuresets (so they would work in the new and legacy
> workflow) and then moving them to the Upgrades jobs zuul v3
> definition, so we don't need to be replicating them. Wdyt?

Hum, make sense actually, sorry for the long unecessary -2.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Need to get rid of the wip then ?'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-11-12 11:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-09-18 16:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Move overcloud_templates_* vars into featuresets for mixed_upgrade jobs.

As part of the work to get rid of the mixed versions
release files we need to move some needed variables
into the featuresets. In this case, the overcloud_templates_*
vars are needed to use the right release-1 templates
when deploying the overcloud. Otherwise, the default
is taken, which is the undercloud templates /usr/share/
openstack-tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I2740e638ff0d2fbf9a70e04c5f891cdaceb92e81

Switch featureset for multinode job for master/stein

After switching tripleo default network driver to ovn
we need to switch from fs010 to fs018 which sets OVN env

commit_message:
Add logic/tests for n->n+1 upgrades

This adds the logic to the compose_releases_dictionary function
for n to n+1 upgrades (both undercloud and overcloud). It also
updates the unsupported upgrades tests.

Change-Id: I2055cfe02ce30b26cb741ec2d9b9f11f8e5934a5

All our base jobs we are actually inheriting from multinode. Multinode
parent makes sense only in multinode job. We are creating hacks in the
nodeset for all the non multinode jobs to skip the multi node handling
partially for single node jobs and totally for ovb.
This change rearranges base jobs into multinode and non multinode. Only
multinode base inherits from multinode base job, the rest will just
inherit from the zuul base job

Change-Id: I0c41e0b22ec05cece79a7689a6645835263ae10e
'}]
commit_message:
Split base job in multinode and non multinode

All our base jobs we are actually inheriting from multinode. Multinode
parent makes sense only in multinode job. We are creating hacks in the
nodeset for all the non multinode jobs to skip the multi node handling
partially for single node jobs and totally for ovb.
This change rearranges base jobs into multinode and non multinode. Only
multinode base inherits from multinode base job, the rest will just
inherit from the zuul base job

Change-Id: I0c41e0b22ec05cece79a7689a6645835263ae10e

commit_message:
Add master to master upgrade job to voting

Since we are now testing master to master for the upgrade
job, we won't hit timeout against this job so we can move it
to voting to gate and test upgrade workflow and framework

Change-Id: Ia1107a854844595c6fde6cde23072c1b5442fac8

[{'created': '2019-02-12 18:20:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add job variables to be available in zuul-variables

Add job variables to be available in collect logs

Add featureset, nodes and environment_type to a file
so that these vars are available for use in the
reproducer generation in collect logs.

commit_message:
Clear metadata before FreeIPA package install

Multinode-ipa jobs are failing to install the
FreeIPA package - reporing modular error.
This review clear the metadata befire package
install.

commit_message:
Update parameter description

Change Id58b4dad29a6ea0f2998d8e41aa09ba0037ea94c deprecate
the `allow_resize_to_same_host` parameter from nova::compute
in favor of same parameter defined in nova::api.

This change updates the description of `allow_resize_to_same_host`
parameter in nova::api.

Change-Id: I10ad60b29b48430d439691533666b8e72b8d0b65

commit_message:
Remove the obsolete --block-migrate parameter

Since Mitaka, nova is able to figure out whether to use
block migration or not all on its own, so we no longer
need to check the storage back-end and react to it.

Change-Id: I5282159ff109a1cccc42426b42869cea5d450a0a
(cherry picked from commit 859d9c05d8c39f6cdadf3eac363aa98fb8f8f208)

subject: Try to fix our way of spawning scripts
messages: [{'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2020-09-18 09:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-09-18 09:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-18 09:06:22.000000000', 'message': 'Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

There is discrepancy between need of adding ./ and not for the
scripts. The resolution is that the ones that have path in variable
are having full path in the variable, there is no need to add "./".

Resolves: UPG-2052
Closes-Bug: #1895960
Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3
(cherry picked from commit 071cc1d8f0334878c58680868f0bee265ec2c8ac)
'}]
commit_message:
Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

There is discrepancy between need of adding ./ and not for the
scripts. The resolution is that the ones that have path in variable
are having full path in the variable, there is no need to add "./".

Resolves: UPG-2052
Closes-Bug: #1895960
Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3
(cherry picked from commit 071cc1d8f0334878c58680868f0bee265ec2c8ac)

commit_message:
[Cinder] Configuration for external ceph backend

In this patchset, comfigmap of ceph.conf and secret of
cinder user keyring is created for externally managed ceph
Cinder backend.

Change-Id: Ie76bf207a7d42bd70a6be2648e060122f7daf5ad

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-27 14:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-31 14:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-09-02 08:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-09-02 14:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-09-03 05:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

Why depends on link with cinder devstack support patch?'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-09-03 13:47:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why depends on link with cinder devstack support patch?

As I said on that patch, I wanted to run it against that to make sure that the devstack patch wouldn't break the nova multistore support, just because it's swizzling things around in the glance driver. It's not an actual dependency for this, I just used it for the test. I don't think there's a major rush to land this, so it might be good to leave it to make sure we don't break that job with the devstack patch, but whatever you want."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-09-14 17:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-09-18 13:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Run the nova-ceph-multistore job against glance

Nova has a job where both nova and glance are configured for multistore
ceph, and where the image gets automatically copied from the file to
rbd stores on first use. Run that on glance to get the coverage for
it as well.

Change-Id: I9c734fabaabe78ea8f7e77d0aa2112ebe867ecb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-18 05:57:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove race during mysql database creation

The mysql database is create by container mysql_bootstrap,
which let Kolla run mysqld_safe temporarily, and then
let TripleO run it for additional setup.

Before running the second temporary mysqld server, make
sure that the mysqld_safe script started by Kolla is
always stopped, to avoid any race condition that would
cause the second mysqld_safe server to be killed by the
Kolla one.

Change-Id: Id7cf45fb95d3c8a2c5519b1a13a5651cf414a115
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Closes-Bug: #1896009
'}]
commit_message:
Remove race during mysql database creation

The mysql database is create by container mysql_bootstrap,
which let Kolla run mysqld_safe temporarily, and then
let TripleO run it for additional setup.

Before running the second temporary mysqld server, make
sure that the mysqld_safe script started by Kolla is
always stopped, to avoid any race condition that would
cause the second mysqld_safe server to be killed by the
Kolla one.

Change-Id: Id7cf45fb95d3c8a2c5519b1a13a5651cf414a115
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Closes-Bug: #1896009

commit_message:
pcs commands on host: haproxy bundle

This implements the creation of the haproxy bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: We had to remove a few tags that were present befaure because we want
to avoid that puppet checks for /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg existence
on the host.

Related-Bug: #1863442

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

Change-Id: I20dc57a02a315ca361883b73e4fb1cb98cf438cb
(cherry picked from commit a11622359002597c7f32c6efeda745b8500a34e6)

commit_message:
[Libvirt] Add support for Cinder external ceph backend

This patchset adds a libvirt secret for the Cinder uuid of external
ceph backend when Cinder externally managed ceph backend is
enabled.

Change-Id: I3667c13c31e49f00d2be02efa6d791ce0a580a8d

subject: WIP: use testresources for sharing across unit tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 20:20:42.000000000', 'message': "WIP: use testresources for sharing across unit tests

Reworking of https://review.opendev.org/663065

Changes (cmurphy):
  Put setup code in setUp(), fixtures can't use __init__ for setup

  Fix the Bootstrap fixture

  Create a testresources.FixtureResource for bootstrap that overrides
  getResource

  Prevent the database fixture from cleaning up so we don't lose the default domain etc

  Only use testresources for bootstrap

  Use testr instead of stestr to load tests - stestr does some kind of
  garbage collection that resets state inbetween tests

Change-Id: I936abf45a029466e5503768207bfe7e5b7eb4104
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: use testresources for sharing across unit tests

Reworking of https://review.opendev.org/663065

Changes (cmurphy):
  Put setup code in setUp(), fixtures can't use __init__ for setup

  Fix the Bootstrap fixture

  Create a testresources.FixtureResource for bootstrap that overrides
  getResource

  Prevent the database fixture from cleaning up so we don't lose the default domain etc

  Only use testresources for bootstrap

  Use testr instead of stestr to load tests - stestr does some kind of
  garbage collection that resets state inbetween tests

Change-Id: I936abf45a029466e5503768207bfe7e5b7eb4104

commit_message:
ovn: Enable DVR for multinode jobs

DVR is disabled by default in Neutron. It makes sense to enable it for
the multinode jobs.

Change-Id: Id5d645970e934e31defdf434d0d0ef18671a2901

[{'created': '2020-09-14 16:45:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add object-store relation

Change-Id: Ia59e1286ca25a71bcdf74be38c9dffb07c5be64f
'}, {'created': '2020-09-14 17:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add object-store relation

Implements the swift-proxy interface. This is needed in order for
the glance (or any other) charm to be able to consume RadosGW the

commit_message:
Add object-store relation

Implements the swift-proxy interface. This is needed in order for
the glance (or any other) charm to be able to consume RadosGW the
same way they would consume Swift.

Change-Id: Ia59e1286ca25a71bcdf74be38c9dffb07c5be64f

commit_message:
Use os_service_default instead of undef to unset parameters

This patch replaces usage of undef by os_service_default, so that
we can simiplify the logics implemented in each manifests.

Change-Id: I098594de598e52be181f32765d02774770ba3bc0

used in test.

commit_message:
Add option to pass rhel-modules to tripleo_container_image_build

When building RHEL-based containers, there is an option
to set the modules used. This review adds the ability
to pass the rhel-modules option from
tripleo_container_image_build.

The rhel-modules option is already added to the client:
https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/v2/tripleo_container_image.py#L212

Change-Id: Ia39b61f6fb6728fad62ee803f05d94a5f604cf6d

commit_message:
Explicitly enable/disable active/active

As deployers may have usecases with several different backends being
served with the same cinder volume,
we should provide an option to easily override default behaviour

Change-Id: Idc9a71d722b7443cf1437c2d95f75c615b6035a4

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
messages: [{'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-09-17 16:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-18 14:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nTrivial change. Fast approving.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 16:20:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I36d26f34df8e5791533dc1a290a77d01981625af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I36d26f34df8e5791533dc1a290a77d01981625af

commit_message:
glance: skip qemu-img related checks as those are unstable on Centos

Centos, which is used for the CI is not providing vdi support so we
need to skip those tests during the build.

Change-Id: I9911ba8c2410274d96b7451d12677f3a973d1a21

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-18 09:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

There is discrepancy between need of adding ./ and not for the
scripts. The resolution is that the ones that have path in variable
are having full path in the variable, there is no need to add "./".

Resolves: UPG-2052
Closes-Bug: #1895960
Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3
(cherry picked from commit 071cc1d8f0334878c58680868f0bee265ec2c8ac)
'}]
commit_message:
Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

There is discrepancy between need of adding ./ and not for the
scripts. The resolution is that the ones that have path in variable
are having full path in the variable, there is no need to add "./".

Resolves: UPG-2052
Closes-Bug: #1895960
Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3
(cherry picked from commit 071cc1d8f0334878c58680868f0bee265ec2c8ac)

subject: glance_store: fix directory permission conflict with glance
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27380, 'name': 'Boyron Sébastien', 'email': 'sboyron@redhat.com', 'username': 'sboyron'}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

CI seems happy with Sebastien's proposed approach.

However I found this a bit disturbing to manage this in glance_store, so maybe we should put some changes on build ordering to avoid this kind of issue."}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:39:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As I said on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752474 

My understanding of RPM is that a %dir is owned by only one package. (https://rpm-packaging-guide.github.io/)

Since there glance requires glance_store, from a pure RPM point of view; only glance_store should manage this %dir. From a user point of view, it's confusing to have /etc/glance manages by glance_store instead of glance."}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-09-18 12:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-18 12:11:07.000000000', 'message': 'glance_store: fix directory permission conflict with glance

The directories need to be exactly identical setup between glance
and glance_store.

Change-Id: I80aac7f16d6bfd625faf87575a63b7e156fb7efd
'}]
commit_message:
glance_store: fix directory permission conflict with glance

The directories need to be exactly identical setup between glance
and glance_store.

Change-Id: I80aac7f16d6bfd625faf87575a63b7e156fb7efd

Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I5875f1c0261ff6039773d7daf412102f2c02651f

Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-15 08:31:59.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: refactor pip configuration

Currently we perform pip configuration for a list of users, including
pip_conf.yml in a loop for each user. It is slightly more efficient to
loop over each task, since individual tasks have a higher overhead than
loops.

This change refactors the code into multiple loops, with a single
include. We keep the include to allow skipping the tasks when pip
configuration is not required.

Change-Id: I698d38613f45bd03a2e51572f6e6fb69e934f614
Story: 2007993
Task: 40719
(cherry picked from commit 43650cb966daf6dd059d44d3e7bd0fc1b0dac945)
'}]
commit_message:
Performance: refactor pip configuration

Currently we perform pip configuration for a list of users, including
pip_conf.yml in a loop for each user. It is slightly more efficient to
loop over each task, since individual tasks have a higher overhead than
loops.

This change refactors the code into multiple loops, with a single
include. We keep the include to allow skipping the tasks when pip
configuration is not required.

Change-Id: I698d38613f45bd03a2e51572f6e6fb69e934f614
Story: 2007993
Task: 40719
(cherry picked from commit 43650cb966daf6dd059d44d3e7bd0fc1b0dac945)

[{'created': '2020-09-03 15:04:44.000000000', 'message': 'Rework jobs so failed devstack does not retry the job

commit_message:
Rework jobs so failed devstack does not retry the job

Per clarkb, should any step in pre.yaml fail, zuul presently retries
the entire job up to the built in retry limit which cannot be changed
or disabled on a job basis. In the terms of setting up devstack, this
is not ideal as devstack is not perfect and can often fail for unrelated
reasons such as package mirrors being updated or even another project
or component failing to setup properly.

As such, in order to be good neighbors and minimize the amount of
time it takes to troubleshoot such issues, we need to move the
devstack setup into the main part of the CI job.

Change-Id: I08d6f3132ebc045ba7e2d1295efe39af7c57187c

commit_message:
Support for Scale Specific Action Driver

Supported:
* Created new ActionDriver framework
* Add standard action for Scaling
* Call ActionDriver executor from vnflcm_driver
* Read implementation from VNFD

Change-Id: I9ba87a1620e9b5bb350e0202af025a1cc4bbfaef

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-11 09:21:17.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] rbd patch for volume local cache

Currently rbd volume is mounted directly via VM(QEMU), so volume local
cache feature cannot be used for rbd(ceph). Somebody ask how to evaluate
volume local cache for rbd, here is the patch and steps.

Steps to enable:
- Apply below 3 patches if these still not been merged yet:
  * Nova patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663542/
  * os-brick patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663549/
    in e.g. /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/os_brick
  * Cinder patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700799/
- Download open-cas and create cache instance, if using devstack, just:
  enable_plugin devstack-plugin-open-cas https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-open-cas
- Add config in nova-cpu.conf, and restart nova-cpu service
  [compute]
  volume_local_cache_driver=opencas
  volume_local_cache_instance_ids=1
- Create cacheable volume type
  Add extra spec: cacheable <is> True
  Key is "cacheable"
  value is "<is> True"

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663542/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663549/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700799/
Change-Id: I9afbff9a707920ec6b0dfb44f90eb262ba3a7f0d
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] rbd patch for volume local cache

Currently rbd volume is mounted directly via VM(QEMU), so volume local
cache feature cannot be used for rbd(ceph). Somebody ask how to evaluate
volume local cache for rbd, here is the patch and steps.

Steps to enable:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750872/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663542/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663549/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700799/
Change-Id: I9afbff9a707920ec6b0dfb44f90eb262ba3a7f0d
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add allow_delete_snapshot_before_volume config option

Adds allow_delete_snapshot_before_volume config option, that controls
whether to test only situation where first test deletes volume and
then snapshot or also second situation, where first test deletes
snapshot and then volume. Second situation is impossible with Ceph [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/ussuri/drivers.html#rbddriver

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: Ib422331892f077d78e3f2efbdd88abafc4c52b9a

commit_message:
Change metalsmith nodeset to Focal

By default, metalsmith jobs relied upon the devstack
default which would pull in bionic, but as we want to
test UEFI soon, we need to have focal jobs for the working
uefi driver PXE network stack.

Also disables dstat as we don't presently use it and it seems
broken on focal. :\

Change-Id: I411e2bc9c15ee4fb77fba980e1924823fe16ba3f

commit_message:
Fix open redirect

Make sure the "next" URL is in the same origin as Horizon before
redirecting to it.

Change-Id: I06b2bfc8e3638591615547780c3fa34b0abe19f6
Closes-bug: #1865026

commit_message:
Fix volume retype with AZ

This patch fixes volume type retyping when multiple
availability zones are in place.  This ensures that the
request_spec to the scheduler has the availability zone
in the right place for the AvailabilityZoneFilter to be
able to see it and use it for filtering.

Change-Id: I3f6cca6eb87ac4727b06b167b5aa12da07ba8fb5
Closes-Bug: #1883928

commit_message:
Add compatibility for 'vip' field in network data v2

In the proposed network data v2 format the 'vip' field is
moved to the subnet section. This is'nt compatible with
the THT jinja2 templating which expect the 'vip' to be on
the network level.

Add a compatibility in the template processing so that the
'vip' field is added to the network internally when processing
templates.

Note: Also re-factor to keep code closer in line with the
depends-on change.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/752076
Change-Id: Ibe5045e48c090d3039e951ef826e7f3877fe2061

commit_message:
Add compatibility for 'vip' field in network data v2

In the proposed network data v2 format the 'vip' field is
moved to the subnet section. This is'nt compatible with
the THT jinja2 templating which expect the 'vip' to be on
the network level.

Add a compatibility in the template processing so that the
'vip' field is added to the network internally when processing
templates.

Also refactor, the conditional to insert 'compat_name' was
put at the wrong indentation level. Refactor to do as little
as possible if network is disabled.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/752437
Change-Id: Ibe5045e48c090d3039e951ef826e7f3877fe2061

commit_message:
Avoid setting IPADDR=0.0.0.0

Configuring network interfaces with IPADDR=0.0.0.0 may fail with:
Error, some other host (FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF) already uses address 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I908dc3320cb1dce7a040a1dbfeac414ace22d6e3
Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Bezak <bartosz@stackhpc.com>
Story: 2007900
Task: 40289
(cherry picked from commit 2606c23812be510c1f8ced03a5e0c32a218d827d)

commit_message:
Fix ignored test cases for nova::compute::libvirt

This patch fixes unit test cases for nova::copute::libvirt, which were
completely ignored during test cases.
This path also fixes some broken test cases and minor behavior of the
manifest file about "undef".

Conflicts:
        spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb

Change-Id: If5155db8635ad73ea1900a0143367802b9b159e8
Closes-Bug: #1895171
(cherry picked from commit b86570f7a3f6ff1f8f02af8af2abaef8b99403b3)

added.

Depends-On: I80b7a5cc87d7d53bb55d4d65999a0f9b3cdcb77d

commit_message:
Sync charms.ceph to pick up EC fix for Ceph-fs

Sync charms.ceph to pick up EC fix for Ceph-fs. This patch enables
clients on the mds relation to request additional data pools to be
added.

Depends-On: I80b7a5cc87d7d53bb55d4d65999a0f9b3cdcb77d
Change-Id: I48348ab2b6c8952c5e22008a074a60c1f35be952

[{'created': '2020-03-20 15:36:45.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to hacking 2.0

Make the code compatible with hacking rules:
* import order problems
* line break before/after binary operator (for this added ignore for
W503, line break before binary operator, as if I understand well the
suggested is to have the line break before the operator)
* indentation problems

I removed the rule N530 (Direct neutron imports not allowed), as that is
a longer story.

commit_message:
Switch to hacking 3.0.1 and to testing on focal

Make the code compatible with hacking rules:
* import order problems
* line break before/after binary operator (for this added ignore for
W504, line break after binary operator
* indentation problems

I removed the rule N530 (Direct neutron imports not allowed), as that is
a longer story.

Fix mysql syntax in tools/test-setup.sh
Fix constraints files for testing on focal

Change-Id: Iacb12d5add773404468e2b755cf95c4e6e54ec99
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708965/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/752416

commit_message:
Block on fip creation before starting the ping test.

We wait for the fip to be reachable during ~1minutes before starting
the ping test.  We fail if it's not reachable in that time frame.

Change-Id: I20cecd06834ef424599d9e281f0d6a6434f584a5
Closes-Bug: #1895829
(cherry picked from commit 306aa3b1996daddd2a81f6045ebbe47550bbc128)

commit_message:
Avoid setting IPADDR=0.0.0.0

Configuring network interfaces with IPADDR=0.0.0.0 may fail with:
Error, some other host (FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF) already uses address 0.0.0.0.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 21:41:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove openstack-python-jobs from GBP templates

The openstack-python-jobs causes problems for stable/ussuri, as it
adds py27 jobs. Since python2.7 is deprecated in ussuri, we need
to remove this from the GBP gate jobs. Once merged, the GBP projects
will need to modify their local zuul configuration to ensure that the
required jobs (e.g. py36, py37) are included.

Change-Id: I07bfb3d20cd7ed855f38de0345f275df06ab0a10
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openstack-python-jobs from GBP templates

The openstack-python-jobs causes problems for stable/ussuri, as it
adds py27 jobs. Since python2.7 is deprecated in ussuri, we need
to remove this from the GBP gate jobs. Once merged, the GBP projects
will need to modify their local zuul configuration to ensure that the
required jobs (e.g. py36, py37) are included.

Change-Id: I07bfb3d20cd7ed855f38de0345f275df06ab0a10

commit_message:
fakelibvirt: Use versionutils to set min versions found in the driver

These were previously manually converted ints based on the version
tuples present in the driver. To avoid ever needing to worry about these
again this change simply uses versionutils to covert the tuples found in
the driver into ints used by fakelibvirt.

Change-Id: I864494e11ff697788167c996a39f38d3d833d0d7

commit_message:
Use stable constraint in tox to release new tag for Victoria

We are going to release Tempest new tag to declare the start of support
for stable/victoria. So that new tag use stable/victoria constraint in
the tox env.

For example, if anyone use Tempest 25.0.0 in future, let's say 1 year
later then tox env also should use the victoria constraint for
compatibility instead of master.

These need to be move back to master constraint, once release is done.

By using master constraint in tox for all the old tag is problem and we
faced the issue of constraint incompatibility due to that and we have to
workaround it all over the devstack, tempest role, grenade to set the
stable constraint via env var.

Further information:
 https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/requirement_upper_constraint_for_tempest.html

Change-Id: I1f8c788327b4a1a7f804cf01f8c22609e6646dd9

Remove six.moves

- six.moves.StringIO
- six.moves.reduce
- six.moves.urllib
- six.moves.http_client
- six.moves.queue

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-16 06:45:05.000000000', 'message': "Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

Adding pipefail is useless if we only run one specific shell script
which already has pipefail in it.

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3

commit_message:
Try to fix our way of spawning scripts

We should always default to executable /usr/bin/bash instead of
adding bash into shell command as it might cause hangs for example
in the timestamper awk waiting for bash and not the script
we wanted to run.

We already set chdir so we don't need to specify {{ working_dir }}.

We should always have in mind reruns and never overwrite already
existing logs. Always use tee -a or >>.

There is discrepancy between need of adding ./ and not for the
scripts. The resolution is that the ones that have path in variable
are having full path in the variable, there is no need to add "./".

Resolves: UPG-2052
Closes-Bug: #1895960
Change-Id: I987c124eecd9d3d906cac7f9ab18ac4fc28165e3

Change-Id: I80b7a5cc87d7d53bb55d4d65999a0f9b3cdcb77d

commit_message:
Handle additional pools for CephFS

If ceph-fs requests additional pools are added to the ceph fs
share to be created then add them once the share is created.

This allows ceph-fs to specify replicated pools for metadata and
default datapool but to then extend the fs with EC pools.

Change-Id: I80b7a5cc87d7d53bb55d4d65999a0f9b3cdcb77d

commit_message:
Add libssl devel package for CentOS and Suse

which is direct keystone requirement [1]

Change-Id: I43df6a6b70195e21e0845565d12aeed5a34d2cda

commit_message:
Support for iSCSI targets backed by an EC pool

Add support for creating an iscsi target backed by an EC pool.
The associated testing pr adds a test so that an EC backed
target is mounted in addition to a replication backed target.
This change also includes renaming the config option pool-name to
rbd-pool-name to make this charm more consistent with other charms
that relate to ceph.

Change-Id: I5772b4fc2415dd90029c3bde38bc57d490c9e910
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/412

commit_message:
Support MDS clients requesting addional pools

Allow MDS clients to specify additional pools to be added to the
FS being created.

Also drive-by fixes to calls to self.send_request_if_needed

Change-Id: Ib19e545fc676fa9e986f3fddcfb92cf99e778a3f

commit_message:
Deprecate mariadb image

mariadb-server image has been introduced in [1], this change deprecates mariadb
image which is identical.

commit_message:
Avoid setting IPADDR=0.0.0.0

Configuring network interfaces with IPADDR=0.0.0.0 may fail with:
Error, some other host (FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF) already uses address 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I908dc3320cb1dce7a040a1dbfeac414ace22d6e3
Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Bezak <bartosz@stackhpc.com>
Story: 2007900
Task: 40289

commit_message:
config option to set of_inactivity_probe

This patch adds support for setting of-inactivity-probe in
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/openvswitch_agent.ini

[ovs]
of_inactivity_probe = 10

Change-Id: Idb3ab6b0e82200226e3063065192b4346d0c5206
Closes-Bug: 1852582

commit_message:
Receive polling-batch-size config

Samples collected can be batched together,
consequently increasing or reducing the
amount of API calls and body data
sent to the configured publisher.

This config is available since Rocky,
receiving the value from ceilometer-charm
to allow its tuning.

Change-Id: I986073fdacd750cf96d662abf1d58844479c25ba
Closes-bug: #1885190

subject: Increase default expel-timeout
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 20634, 'name': 'Chris MacNaughton', 'email': 'chris.macnaughton@canonical.com', 'username': 'Chris.MacNaughton'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20805, 'name': 'David Ames', 'email': 'david@davam.net', 'username': 'thedac'}, {'_account_id': 20870, 'name': 'Alex Kavanagh', 'email': 'alex.kavanagh@canonical.com', 'username': 'ajkavanagh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24824, 'name': 'Dmitrii Shcherbakov', 'email': 'dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com', 'username': 'dmitriis'}, {'_account_id': 31289, 'name': 'Aurelien Lourot', 'email': 'aurelien.lourot@gmail.com', 'username': 'lourot'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:08:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm broadly in favour as we've discovered in testing that the default of 5 is too short when a converged system gets very busy.  For production cases, the value can be set in the bundles for sku's."}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:09:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Starting this discussion off, I'd like to reference this change to the rabbitmq charm, where we reverted a change to set a default partition handler to autoheal, as it made deployments very prone to failure: https://github.com/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server/commit/863c6cd97c399ecac4d693b382d0887419879d63

In the same spirit, I think that setting defaults that are reasonable for deployment (ie: highly busy times) is a very good idea and that we should, if there isn't very compelling reasons not to, merge changes like this one."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I never tried 10. I went for 20 directly in the reviews referenced by the linked bug'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so we have the following experience so far: 5 seems too small on OSCI; 20 seems large enough on OSCI.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-09-17 13:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-09-17 15:48:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am very much open to updating the default. Dmitrii's question is valid. We may need to have more discussion about *what* the value should be."}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-09-17 15:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the only way is through trials and errors. Should we be conservative and try with 10 for now?'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-09-17 16:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It would be interesting to have data on 10. But at this point, I think the change is good as is.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-09-18 08:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Increase default expel-timeout

In order to reduce chances of spurious "super-read-only" failures.

Change-Id: I3cfbd6991b743e92d447ba06aa0e466631cec4f6
Closes-Bug: #1882205

recheck -
I guess I could abandon this https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720169/5 once this patch merges. This wait-for-fip time should be enough to get all compute resources up.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-09-17 15:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> recheck -
 > I guess I could abandon this https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720169/5
 > once this patch merges. This wait-for-fip time should be enough to
 > get all compute resources up.

Hum different beast. Yours is wait for compute service to be available, so you can create a vm, this is waiting for the *fip* to be available (after instance creation and compute availability) before starting the ping test.

[{'created': '2020-09-16 12:37:09.000000000', 'message': "Block on fip creation before starting the ping test.

We wait for the fip to be reachable during ~1minutes before starting

Closes-Bug: #1895829

commit_message:
Block on fip creation before starting the ping test.

We wait for the fip to be reachable during ~1minutes before starting
the ping test.  We fail if it's not reachable in that time frame.

Change-Id: I20cecd06834ef424599d9e281f0d6a6434f584a5
Closes-Bug: #1895829

This file is present in both dpkg and debian-minimal element,
causing a failure to build anything with debian.

commit_message:
Temporarily remove ceilometer install

We temporarily remove Ceilometer and Barbican install to execute FT
because Gnocchi and Barbican cannot be installed by some error.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007732
Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008121
Related-Bug: #1889732
Change-Id: I93dbd84cec252bb93257b852aa171d9ca89665c2

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I560753bf1a8be3188e369e462f5e7cbadf342391
