Feedback on this? This would replace Beaker with Litmus. The only negative thing here is that it only supports Puppet >= 6.0.0 (the Litmus gem) so we need to drop Puppet 5 testing.

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-30 21:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

I still need to learn about puppet Litmus now, but in general using more "native" test tools is good idea to me, regarding the fact that Litmus is included in PDK.

One concern here is that it is still experimental[1], which might bring some concern about its stability

[1]  https://puppetlabs.github.io/litmus/

I think switching to Puppet 6 to run tests is no problem regarding the fact that we officially support Puppet 6 only nowadays.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Yeah, we did however promise to not break Puppet 5 in Victoria. But I doubt we, this late in the cycle, would introduce anything that would break Puppet 5.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Also I think it would be safe to adopt Litmus right now, all PuppetLabs supported modules (mysql, apache etc) is already moving or has moved to using Litmus for testing.'}, {'account_id': 28182, 'date': '2020-08-31 11:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-01 12:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-01 12:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(recheck is to test if output is fixed from later p-o-i change)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-01 13:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck - new ps in p-o-i'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-02 12:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-02 15:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

According to the output from puppet, it seems that /etc/sysconfig/libvirtd [1] is updated instead of systemd services, and I guess there is some issue with libvirt version detection [2] ?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/migration/libvirt.pp#L266-L272
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/compute/libvirt/version.pp'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-08 22:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-08 22:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

dont merge, contains debug code now'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-09 12:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hm, it reports CentOS 8.0 in this job and not 8.1 which means [1] does not apply.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/compute/libvirt/version.pp#L14'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-09 12:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Wonder if this is because integration tests does the classic "yum/dnf upgrade" before running but the beaker/litmus testing doesn't'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-09 13:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The problem seems to be that the os on the node is detected as 8.0 instead of 8.2, and it might be referring to the stale facter values.
Does https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750654/ solve the problem ?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-09 23:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-10 22:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-11 08:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@Takashi

2020-09-10 22:36:39.862260 | TASK [Update all packages (CentOS/RHEL)]
2020-09-10 22:36:44.367992 | centos-8 | ok: Nothing to do'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-11 12:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-15 07:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

This must be a nasty bug somewhere, since it reports this packages:

centos-release-8.2-2.2004.0.1.el8.x86_64
centos-repos-8.2-2.2004.0.1.el8.x86_64

And we run directly on the nodes provided by nodepool, facter gathers facts directly from the local system.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-16 20:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-16 22:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-16 22:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

this was a bug in facter that was fixed today :)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-17 06:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

docs: Remove references to XenAPI driver

The XenAPI driver is dead. Let's hold the tissues and clear out
references from the documentation instead.

commit_message:
Fix l-c testing for ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

- Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40206

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: Ib99c13c8c4bbb21dd72836dfb1316f92cdc8aabe

commit_message:
Adding bindep file to pre-install system dependencies

designate lower-constraints is trying to pip install cffi==1.11.5
with python3.8 (the default python3 on ubuntu 20.04 lts), but cffi
didn't publish prebuilt cp38 manylinux1 wheels for that release so
it's having to be built from the sdist instead, and designate doesn't
have any bindep file saying to preinstall libffi to build against,
so the compiler is erroring out

Change the lower constrains to match with python 3.7
greenlet support for python 3.7 started with 0.4.16

Change-Id: Icac35fa4d4f31e30a9d069dacf9f3a87aef76531

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-01 11:01:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert to snapshot for non admins

When a non user calls revert to snapshot using the snapshot name the
client returns a failure status:

  $ cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.59 revert-to-snapshot snap1
    ERROR: No snapshot with a name or ID of 'snap1' exists.

The revert to snapshot API requires an UUID, so the cinderclient lists
the snapshots passing "all_tenants=1" and the name of the snapshot to
find its first when it's not a UUID.

The problem that we were only removing the "all_tenants" filter for
admins, leaving it for normal users and passing it to the DB which
wouldn't understand that filter and return None.

This patch ensure we always remove the "all_tenants" filter (as we do in
other places) before calling the OVO method to list snapshots.

Change-Id: I5fd3d7840b36f6805143cd1b837258232e7bc58a
Fixes-Bug: #1889758
(cherry picked from commit 71a080b22688c2fb15545736e807d233932e22e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revert to snapshot for non admins

When a non user calls revert to snapshot using the snapshot name the
client returns a failure status:

  $ cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.59 revert-to-snapshot snap1
    ERROR: No snapshot with a name or ID of 'snap1' exists.

The revert to snapshot API requires an UUID, so the cinderclient lists
the snapshots passing "all_tenants=1" and the name of the snapshot to
find its first when it's not a UUID.

The problem that we were only removing the "all_tenants" filter for
admins, leaving it for normal users and passing it to the DB which
wouldn't understand that filter and return None.

This patch ensure we always remove the "all_tenants" filter (as we do in
other places) before calling the OVO method to list snapshots.

Change-Id: I5fd3d7840b36f6805143cd1b837258232e7bc58a
Fixes-Bug: #1889758
(cherry picked from commit 71a080b22688c2fb15545736e807d233932e22e8)

- unit tests jobs

Change-Id: Idb053c8b1bfde9870eea80f66e5aef156422a668
'}, {'created': '2020-08-04 23:04:48.000000000', 'message': '[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1885825
Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)
Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

Story: #2007865

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1885825
Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)
Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40196

Closes-Bug: #1885825

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal>

Change-Id: Idb053c8b1bfde9870eea80f66e5aef156422a668

commit_message:
python3-novaclient installation via THT

Let's require python3-novaclient via tht and host_prep_tasks
and remove the need to install it via puppet.

Change-Id: I3dbe35e2037c02cf0436b173bb42578f2a0b2db3

commit_message:
Make sure IPA has the right ACI

We need a special ACI in FreeIPA to allow etcd to obtain a
certificate with an IP SAN.  This ACI needs to be added ahead of
time.  We add a call for a validation here to make sure that the
relevant ACI has been added.

On failure, the installation will fail with instructions to add
the ACI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749575/
Change-Id: I9baaa77b5b846c96cf075244a8ccb6889469b08e
(cherry picked from commit 32934b30abe7bc2318b4607d727f8d05f2a9e497)

commit_message:
Added api to scenario manager

tempest plugins do use check_public_network_
connectivity() api but scenario manager doesn't
implement it.
Hence, added it to the scenario manager

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4acc381c85a44f9a6b33e3de4f254ed0c03d7294

please see the comments.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2020-06-04 03:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

According to PTG discussion:https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cyborg-victoria-goals L169, it seems that deployable API for programming is not sufficient. AFAIK, Haibin Huang has tested with a device in which cyborg can only report device, but deployable is not included. If so, we should consider how to program this kind of device.  Just want to point out this possibility here. 
Btw, Haibin Huang, could you give us more details about your testing here?'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2020-06-05 00:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, for baseline, the FPGA driver just report device without deployable.'}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2020-06-05 02:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'm working with the previous comments for code, and that will be updated, later.

This is comment for last three.

In my understanding, there are 2 discussions now,,
1: collision between VM attach and FPGA programming
  pattern1-1: VM attach between FPGA programming
  pattern1-2: FPGA programming after VM attached, and being used by the VM.
2: programming without deployable

1:
The pattern 1-2 is treated in this patch.. that returns error naturally.
In the pattern 1-1, IMHO, users may be better to use device enable/disable API before programming. Because it seems to be difficult to block VM attach between deployable/programming, or add specific FPGA-programming-detection logic in arq binding, and avoid it.

2:
I would like to know the real situation for it, FPGA board without "deployable".
( e.g. host-accelerator, not used in guest, like an ovs accelerator FPGA NIC? )
IMHO, to add new API for device/PATCH(programming) seems to be better, because operators knows that board should be programmed via device/Programming API, not deployable.'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2020-06-08 02:56:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Any questions about Intel's smartnic, please let me know, if I can not answer I will check with our logical developer.

Currently, our general intel FPGA driver report PR as a deployable. 
That's different for other scenarios, such as smartnic also use A10, but it has no PR. It need a more complex driver. 

Also I know some other FPGA card vendor, they may use other cheap FPGA chips(from intel or xilinx ) instead of A10 in order to reduce cost. No PR in it. it can used for EC or other function, no need as large logic units as A10 or S10.
 
The smartnic we are working, the factory image maybe baseline image, and the user customized image maybe empty. So no any function it can provide to user/VM.


If we want to program the FPGA by deployable, we can generate an empty deployabe in our drivers to work around."}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2020-06-08 12:02:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes, I have see that device update is in plan. That's good.


https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/train/approved/cyborg-api.html

URL: /accelerator/v2/devices/{uuid}
METHOD: PATCH
ROLE: Admin or any tenant with RBAC authorization."}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2020-06-18 10:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It seems to be better that implementation of microversion for programming API should be along with the other APIs after the other basic microversion features have been implemented.
What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2020-08-31 09:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

agree +1 if program api microversion needs other dependencies, it can be implemented in another patch later."}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2020-08-31 10:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Programming support (v2 Deployable API)

This patch add programming method ( PATCH method [1] )
to v2 Deployable API for dynamic FPGA programming.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/train/approved/cyborg-api.html

Change-Id: Ib7cfb386fe769c7dbeb7578ff2475a41e5f447e0
Story: 2006926

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31695, 'date': '2020-08-15 17:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The test didn't pass because built-in `open` function in python2 does not accept file descriptor(integer) as the first argument. What a surprise...(maybe not that surprise ;)). I think the best way to solve it is using `os.fdopen` instead of `open` to open the fd, which works for both python versions. 

I'm not sure how to handle this situation in Gerrit. Do I need to submit another patch?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-17 15:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Ensure image files are readable to apache

If the umask on undercloud is set as something like `077`, the image
files created with `sudo` will not be readable to `others` including
`apache`, which will cause 403 forbidden during image pulling on
overcloud.

So set the permission explicitly just like we already did for
`make_dir` function.

Change-Id: I0f44b21be981f230abdf9baee4eab747a9a46114
(cherry picked from commit a6bbe528973976b95a5ce39647f0176b8f1c84a3)
